medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening pneumonia, increasing hypoxia, and azotemia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until 17 days before admission when she developed nonbloody diarrhea and fatigue. Diarrhea resolved five days later but fatigue persisted and worsened. Seven days before admission, diarrhea recurred, now with vomiting, chills, fever, abdominal cramps, myalgia, and headache. There was no cough, dyspnea, chest pain, or hemoptysis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 1 diabetes mellitus (with diabetic nephropathy and neuropathy), hypertension, pernicious anemia.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of hypertension and coronary disease.
medical_history.social_history: Drank little alcohol, ceased smoking a few cigarettes daily 40 years ago, exercised for one hour daily. No recent travel or exposure to ill persons.
